title: CAX: Cellular Automata Accelerated in JAX
key_finding: Modular architecture supporting discrete/continuous CA in any dimensions, 2000x faster via JAX hardware acceleration, custom rules in 'just a few lines of code'
relevance: Reference for extensible CA platform architecture

title: Detecting emergent processes in cellular automata with excess information
key_finding: Formalized emergence as 'better expressed at coarser granularity'. Tools for flexible coarse-graining to identify emergent processes.
relevance: Mathematical framework for detecting 'patterns on patterns' (emergence hierarchies)

title: On the effect of topology on cellular automata rule spaces
key_finding: Topology (genus-0/1/2 manifolds) significantly alters rule space distributions. Both global structure AND local dynamics define long-term behavior.
relevance: Validates topology as a fundamental research dimension (not just a feature)

title: Emergence of Self-Replicating Hierarchical Structures in a Binary Cellular Automaton
key_finding: Self-replicating structures across TWO spatial/temporal scales. Lower-level clusters generate new clusters, which coalesce into larger formations that also self-replicate.
relevance: Evidence of multi-level emergence (patterns on patterns on patterns)

title: A New Kind of Science
key_finding: Systematic exploration of simple programs. Computational irreducibility means you must run the simulation (no shortcuts). Simplicity of rules doesn't predict complexity of behavior.
relevance: Foundational work on systematic CA exploration and computational irreducibility

title: Wolfram MathWorld - Computational Irreducibility
key_finding: Principle: Only way to determine answer is to perform the computation. No shortcuts. Related to unpredictability and free will.
relevance: Why surveys must actually run rules, not predict them

title: Hierarchical Cellular Automata Methods
key_finding: Multiscale/multiresolution CA systems. Abstraction operator transforms CA into hierarchy of cellular spaces.

title: What Can We Learn about Engineering from Half a Century of Game of Life
key_finding: Computational irreducibility makes engineering in Game of Life possible. Richness comes from irreducibility.
relevance: Research goal: understand what makes certain rule spaces rich for engineering/emergence
